title: RWC quarter-finals: Who plays who ... and when
text:
Cape Town - The pool phase of the 2019 Rugby World Cup in Japan has been completed and we're left with eight countries vying for glory in the ninth instalment of the tournament.

Quarter-finalists:

Pool A

1. Japan

2. Ireland

Pool B

1. New Zealand

2. South Africa

Pool C

1. England

2. France

Pool D

1. Wales

2. Australia

Bidding farewell to the tournament:

Scotland, Samoa, Russia, Italy, Namibia, Canada, Argentina, Tonga, USA, Fiji, Georgia, Uruguay

Quarter-finals fixtures (all times SA):

Saturday, October 19:

England v Australia, Oita - 09:15

New Zealand v Ireland, Tokyo - 12:15

Sunday, October 20

Wales v France, Oita - 09:15

Japan v South Africa, Tokyo - 12:15

Semi-finals

Saturday, October 26

England or Australia v New Zealand or Ireland, Yokohama - 10:00



Sunday, October 27

Wales or France v Japan or South Africa, Yokohama - 11:00



Third place playoff

Friday, November 1

TBC, Tokyo - 11:00



Final

Saturday, November 2

TBC, Yokohama - 11:00



Rugby World Cup winners:

1987 - New Zealand

1991 - Australia

1995 - South Africa

1999 - Australia

2003 - England

2007 - South Africa

2011 - New Zealand

2015 - New Zealand
